title: S.African airline SAA requires $400 mln bailout to stay afloat - treasury official
text:
May 8, 2018 / 10:40 AM / in 12 minutes S.African airline SAA requires $400 mln bailout to stay afloat - treasury official Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
CAPE TOWN, May 8 (Reuters) - South Africaâ€™s state carrier SAA requires a 5 billion rand ($399 million) cash injection in the current financial year to help it meet its financial obligations, a senior treasury official said on Tuesday.
National Treasury director-general Dondo Mogajane told parliament the cash injection could however not come from government, which has so far pumped 20 billion rand into the firm.
Mogajane said treasury was willing to consider selling a stake in the airliner to a private equity partner. ($1 = 12.5532 rand) (Reporting by Wendell Roelf Writing by Mfuneko Toyana Editing by Louise Heavens)
